definition: thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: Europeanization is the output of language contact between the English and Chinese language.
sentences.chinese: 漢語的歐化現象是鴉片戰爭以來英漢語言接觸的產物。

sentences.english: It was after Opium War that Western photography was introduced into China.
sentences.chinese: 攝影術是鴉片戰爭後由西方傳入我國的。

sentences.english: Hong Kong was British Colony occupied for opium wars, exploitations.
sentences.chinese: 香港被英國強佔，發動多次鴉片戰爭，侵略中國。

sentences.english: After the Opium War (1840-1842), western culture began to enter China in a large amount.
sentences.chinese: 鴉片戰爭後，西方文化開始大盤進入中國。

sentences.english: After the Opium War of 1840 -1842, China slowly became semi - colonial and semi - feudal society country.
sentences.chinese: 鴉片戰爭後，中國逐漸淪爲半殖民地半封建國家。

sentences.english: As for the Opium Wars, a strictly legal perspective is ludicrous .
sentences.chinese: 談到鴉片戰爭，嚴格法律的提發是可笑的。

sentences.english: The Opium War of 1840marked a turning piont in chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 1840年爆發的鴉片戰爭標誌着中國歷史的轉折。

sentences.english: Before the opium war China is still an independent state of feudal society.
sentences.chinese: 鴉片戰爭前，中國仍是一個獨立自主的封建制國家。

sentences.english: China never forgave the Anglos for the Opium Wars.
sentences.chinese: 因爲鴉片戰爭，所以中國人永遠不會原諒英國人。

sentences.english: After "The Second Opium War", the Westernization movement has developed.
sentences.chinese: 第二次鴉片戰爭後，洋務運動興起。

sentences.english: And she must forgive the anglos for the Opium Wars.
sentences.chinese: 中國也該原諒英國人在鴉片戰爭中的行爲。

sentences.english: After the Opium War broke out in 1840, China was reduced to a semi-colonial and semi-feudal society.
sentences.chinese: 年鴉片戰爭後，中國逐漸淪爲半殖民地半封建的社會。

sentences.english: After the Opium War, China was gradually reduced to semifeudal and semicolonial society.
sentences.chinese: 鴉片戰爭後，中國逐步淪爲半封建半殖民地社會。

sentences.english: The British forces had been aggressing and harassing Dalian during the two opium wars.
sentences.chinese: 兩次鴉片戰爭期間，英軍曾對大連進行侵略與騷擾。

sentences.english: And this anti-drug law has its roots, and that is the Opium War.
sentences.chinese: 反毒品法有其淵源，那就是鴉片戰爭。

sentences.english: Qing Dynasty Opium War decline, the country mourning the right of the Treaty of Nanking.
sentences.chinese: 鴉片戰爭清朝衰，南京條約喪國權。

definition: Treaty of Shimonoseki (1895), concluding the First Sino-Japanese War 甲午戰爭|甲午战争[Jia3 wu3 Zhan4 zheng1]
to close a country/to exclude foreign contact/closed country (Qing China, North Korea etc)
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
to open up a port for trade/to open treaty ports
Self-Strengthening Movement (period of reforms in China c 1861-1894), also named 自強運動|自强运动
the Mukden or Manchurian Railway Incident of 18th September 1931 used by the Japanese as a pretext to annex Manchuria/also known as Liutiaogou incident 柳條溝事變|柳条沟事变

pinyin: Di4 er4 Ci4 Shi4 jie4 Da4 zhan4

definition: Eight-Nation Alliance, involved in a military intervention in northern China in 1900
the New Culture Movement (mid-1910s and 1920s), intellectual revolution against Confucianism aiming to introduce Western elements, especially democracy and science
